content: Please confirm you want to change the {{productName}} owner to {{newOwner}}.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message that asks users to confirm changing the owner of a product. It appears as a subtitle in a UI element and provides context through placeholders for the product name and new owner.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "{{productName}}-Besitzer werden soll" is a bit awkward. It literally translates to 'should become {{productName}}-owner'. A more natural and accurate translation would be 'der/die {{productName}}-Besitzer/in wird'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bitte bestätigen Sie, dass {{newOwner}} der/die {{productName}}-Besitzer/in wird.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The German translation lacks a comma after 'Bitte bestätigen Sie'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bitte bestätigen Sie, dass {{newOwner}} der/die {{productName}}-Besitzer/in wird.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The French translation 'Veuillez confirmer le changement de propriétaire de {{productName}}. Nouveau propriétaire : {{newOwner}}.' doesn't fully convey the original English sentence 'Please confirm you want to change the {{productName}} owner to {{newOwner}}.'. It omits the 'you want to' part which is crucial for clarity and user consent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Veuillez confirmer que vous souhaitez changer le propriétaire de {{productName}} à {{newOwner}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation separates the 'new owner' with a colon which doesn't reflect the original English format. While not a critical error, consistency matters.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Veuillez confirmer que vous souhaitez changer le propriétaire de {{productName}} à {{newOwner}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation 'սեփականատիրոջը' is a genitive case and doesn't quite convey the intended meaning of 'owner'. A more accurate translation would be something along the lines of 'ըստեփանակիրոջը'. While technically grammatically correct, it may sound unnatural in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Խնդրում ենք հաստատել, որ ցանկանում եք փոխել {{productName}} սեփականատիրոջը ըստեփանակիրոջը {{newOwner}}:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The colon (:) at the end of the Armenian sentence feels slightly awkward and unnecessary. It breaks the flow and isn't standard in this type of confirmation message.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Խնդրում ենք հաստատել, որ ցանկանում եք փոխել {{productName}} սեփականատիրոջը ըստեփանակիրոջը {{newOwner}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Italian phrase 'Conferma di voler' is slightly awkward. It's more natural to use 'Conferma che vuoi'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Conferma che vuoi cambiare il proprietario di {{productName}} in {{newOwner}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation includes "님" after {{newOwner}}. While common, this level of formality might not be appropriate for all contexts and could be adjusted based on brand voice and target audience. Consider if it is necessary or if a more neutral option would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing "님" or replacing it with a less formal alternative, depending on the desired tone.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation uses 'ຜູ້ໃຊ້ເກົ່າ' which translates to 'old user'. The English 'owner' in this context refers to the owner of a product or asset, not a user. A more accurate translation is needed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ກະລຸນາຢືນຢັນວ່າທ່ານຕ້ອງການທີ່ຈະປ່ຽນເຈົ້າຂອງ {{productName}} ເປັນ {{newOwner}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation lacks a proper space before the variable substitution {{productName}}.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ກະລຸນາຢືນຢັນວ່າທ່ານຕ້ອງການທີ່ຈະປ່ຽນເຈົ້າຂອງ {{productName}} ເປັນ {{newOwner}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation "Potwierdź zmianę właściciela {{productName}} na {{newOwner}}" doesn't fully convey the original meaning of 'Please confirm you want to'. It implies a confirmation of the change itself, rather than the desire to make the change. A more accurate translation would be something like 'Proszę potwierdzić, że chcesz zmienić właściciela...'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Proszę potwierdzić, że chcesz zmienić właściciela {{productName}} na {{newOwner}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation lacks the polite 'proszę' in the opening, making it sound abrupt.  Adding 'proszę' improves the politeness level aligning with the original English.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Proszę potwierdzić, że chcesz zmienić właściciela {{productName}} na {{newOwner}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'ඔබට {{productName}} හිමිකරු {{newOwner}} ලෙස වෙනස් කිරීමට වුවමනා බව තහවුරු කරන්න.' doesn't perfectly capture the nuance of 'Please confirm you want to change the {{productName}} owner to {{newOwner}}.' A more accurate translation might emphasize confirmation of the change itself.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබ {{productName}} හිමිකරු {{newOwner}} ලෙස වෙනස් කිරීම් තහවුරු කරන්න.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While understandable, the phrasing 'ඔබට {{productName}} හිමිකරු {{newOwner}} ලෙස' could be slightly improved for a more natural flow in Sinhala. 'ඔබ' (you) is unnecessary in this context. Removing it makes the sentence more direct.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබ {{productName}} හිමිකරු {{newOwner}} ලෙස වෙනස් කිරීමට වුවමනා බව තහවුරු කරන්න.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation uses "власника" (vlasnika) which is the genitive singular form. In this context, the nominative singular form "власник" (vlasnik) would be more appropriate as it refers to the new owner.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Молимо вас потврдите да желите да промените {{productName}} власник на {{newOwner}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'promenite' (change) is spelled correctly, but the more formal and preferred version in this context would be 'izmenite'. While 'promenite' isn't *incorrect*, 'izmenite' sounds more professional for a confirmation prompt.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Molimo vas potvrdite da želite da izmenite {{productName}} vlasnika na {{newOwner}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'Please confirm you want to' is best translated as 'Lütfen onaylayın' or 'Lütfen teyit edin' instead of simply 'Lütfen onaylayın'. The direct translation sounds slightly formal and stiff in Turkish.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Lütfen {{productName}} sahibini {{newOwner}} olarak değiştirmek için onaylayın.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'Підтвердьте' is a less common and slightly archaic form. The more modern and preferred spelling is 'Підтвердіть'.
